alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Eastern Alachua; Western Alachua (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 2:16PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Bradford and northwestern Alachua Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 215 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Alachua, or 8 miles south of Worthington Spring, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Alachua, High Springs, Newberry and La Crosse. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
